title: Standard Of Living - Six Songs (1982)
description:
I couldn't find any information about Standard Of Living online, though their record label "Vinyl Records" was located in Oakland, CA. They're what I suppose you'd call a minimal synth band, pretty heavy on noise. Some of the noisier tracks might lead you to believe that your speakers or headphone is broken. And they might be.

Two of the songs are covers and you might love them, but you'll probably hate them. They seem strangely out of place with their listless female lead vocals and if you take them out of the equation, you'll find the rest of this EP a rather catchy, quirky gem from the obscura of the 80's.

A1 N.F.A. 2:14
A2 Dancing In The Street 5:11	
A3 So Hard 2:23
B1 Don't Worry 2:29
B2 Immune To You 2:13
B3 She Loves You 2:23	

Engineer - Gregory Jones
Guitar, Bass, Vocals - Jon Velcro
Percussion, Vocals, Keyboards, Synthesizer, Guitar - Rad Solar
Producer - Roy Sablosky
Vocals - Colleen Hinks
Vocals, Percussion, Guitar - Gene Gabriel
